body:
This PR adds the following commands to the Ruff language server: * `RuffFixAll`: Fix all auto-fixable problems in the current buffer * `RuffOrganizeImports`: Organize imports in the current buffer * `RuffFormat`: Format the current buffer ## Preview
Command execution

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/59113086-614d-454b-8b52-9ac5c93ecd36

Documentation

_via `grip`_

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  local client = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, name = 'ruff', method = 'workspace/executeCommand' })[1]
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,23 @@
 local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
 
+local function execute_command(command)
+  local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+  local client = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, name = 'ruff' })[1]

comment_data.body: It looks like this does the same thing as `:help Client:exec_cmd()`. So that should be used instead of adding `execute_command`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,23 @@
 local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
 
+local function execute_command(command)
+  local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+  local client = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, name = 'ruff', method = 'workspace/executeCommand' })[1]
+  if client == nil then
+    return
+  end
+
+  client.request('workspace/executeCommand', {

comment_data.body: I see, thanks for the suggestion. It seems that `exec_cmd` is only available on 0.11 so I'd need to add a compact layer here. I'll update it.

comment_data.body:
Nope. Not going to add extra code for optional things like this, just for Nvim 0.10.

If this is needed at all, do it in a way that uses the least amount of code, using Nvim 0.11 features.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,23 @@
 local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
 
+local function execute_command(command)
+  local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+  local client = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, name = 'ruff', method = 'workspace/executeCommand' })[1]
+  if client == nil then
+    return
+  end
+
+  client.request('workspace/executeCommand', {

comment_regular_data.body: Aren't these already available as code actions?

> Aren't these already available as code actions?

The language server exposes `source.fixAll`, `source.organizeImports` and it's `.ruff` prefixed code actions (which are standard for most language servers) but not for formatting.

I think users might find it more easier to check the documentation and see that these commands already exists in oppose to having an understanding of the details of code actions.

My main motivation for doing this is from seeing that `nvim-lspconfig` already defines commands for other language servers like `texlab`, `pyright`, `oxc`, etc.

> I think users might find it more easier to check the documentation and see that these commands already exists in oppose to having an understanding of the details of code actions.

No, that's not maintainable. Anything available as codeactions should not be added as a redundant command. All of these commands must be maintained. Do not add redundant commands for anything available as codeactions.

It is ABSOLUTELY required that users know how to ask "what are the codeactions". That is a key entrypoint that allows us to avoid tons of extra code. If users don't know about that, then we're screwed. 

Nvim 0.11 has a default `gra` mapping which invokes codeactions.

> My main motivation for doing this is from seeing that `nvim-lspconfig` already defines commands for other language servers like `texlab`, `pyright`, `oxc`, etc.

Not a good reason.

> No, that's not maintainable. Anything available as codeactions should not be added as a redundant command. All of these commands must be maintained. Do not add redundant commands for anything available as codeactions.
> 
> It is ABSOLUTELY required that users know how to ask "what are the codeactions". That is a key entrypoint that allows us to avoid tons of extra code. If users don't know about that, then we're screwed.

I think that's reasonable. Sorry for wasting your time, I'll close this PR then.

title: feat(ruff): `RuffFixAll`, `RuffOrganizeImports`, `RuffFormat` commands
